statement.tex: \text{Differentiate the following function}\\ \text{with respect to x}\\ \quad f(x) = \sec (\tan\sqrt{x})
\\ \text{If }\sec (\tan (\sqrt{x})) = f(\, g(\, h(x)\,)\,), \\ \text{then what are f,g and h?}
\\ \textbf{Right or wrong? } \text{Given }y = (f\circ g\circ h)(x), \\ \frac{dy}{dx}\text{ evaluates to the following.}

reason.tex: \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|} \hline f(x) & g(x) & h(x) & f(\,g(\,h(x)\,)\, ) \\ \hline \sec x & \tan x & \sqrt{x} & f(\,g(\sqrt{x})\,)\\ & & & = f(\,\tan (\sqrt{x} )\,) \\ & & & = \sec(\,\tan (\sqrt{x})\,) \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ f(\,g(\,h(x)\,)\,)\textbf{ is normally written as }(f\circ g\circ h)(x). \\ \textbf{And just for fun }\\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline (g\circ f\circ h)(x) & \tan(\sec(\sqrt{x})) \\ \hline (h\circ g\circ f)(x) & \sqrt{\tan (\sec x)} \\ \hline (h\circ f\circ g)(x) & \sqrt{\sec(\tan x)} \\ \hline \end{tabular}
